newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel's Solel Boneh plans Tel Aviv offering.
newsitem.headline: Israel's Solel Boneh plans Tel Aviv offering.

text.p: Israel's leading construction contractor, Solel Boneh Building & Infrastructure Ltd, is planning an initial public offering on the Tel Aviv Stock Exchange, a company spokesman said on Thursday.
The company has filed a draft prospectus with the exchange based on its 1996 financial results and therefore has until the end of May to hold the offering, the spokesman said.
The spokesman said the company had begun talks with Israel's securities authority over the size and other details of the offering. It is also in talks with prospective underwriters.
Israel's Haaretz newspaper said the offering would value the company at 500 million shekels but the spokesman said he could not comment on the figure.
The firm cancelled plans for an offering in 1994 after share prices on the Tel Aviv market plunged.
The company had turnover of 1.7 billion shekels in 1995. It is a subsidiary of Housing & Construction Holding Co.
The spokesman said Housing & Construction had taken a decision to seek partners for its subsidiaries.

Arison Investments, the Israeli investment arm of billionaire businessman Ted Arison, bought 21 percent of Housing & Construction last year from the group's workers, who own most of Housing & Construction.
